content:
re :3. coped profiles into \roaming directory

When you say 'profiles' - this normally refers to the actual 'profile name' folder. If you do mean the actual profile name folder then it should not be in the 'roaming/' directory.

The folder you would have copied from the old 'Roaming/' directory is called 'Thunderbird' and that would be copied into the new laptop 'Roaming/directory. It is here in Windows OS: C://Users/user name/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird

Actual profile name folders typically look like this: abc123x.default These profile name folders would be in this location in Windows OS: C://Users/user name/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profile/<profile name > folders


re : The problem is that the Mail toolbar is nowhere to be found.

It does not exist anymore.

It has been replaced by the 'Unified Toolbar' which by default is now above the 'Menu Bar' toolbar. You can get the 'Menu Bar' above the 'Unified toolbar' but you need to use the info at this link.

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1422908

You need to customise your Unified Toolbar. Right click on it and choose 'Customise'

There are Help Article on this:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unified-toolbar
  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/new-thunderbird-115-supernova
creator: Toad-Hall

content:

/* Position Menu Bar above Unified Toolbar */

  1. toolbar-menubar {

order: -1 !important; }

3. started Thunderbird and nothing changed. There is no unified toolbar visible. creator: m_nowak

content:
If this is in Windows, if you can see the top of your window where it shows the - box and x, you can resize your window to address the problem. If you click on the box and nothing changes, you may need to manually resize your window. Do not click on one of those three symbols. Instead, if you click and hold on a free space in that top potion, you can drag your window down and to left or right. Then, you can move your mouse until an arrowed line segment pointing up and down appears. Click and hold as you drag your window down so that it is a smaller size than it was before. Now, you should be able to see the bottom of your window.

If that is not the problem you are facing, please provide a greater description.

Thank you and good luck. KJK

content: That is because IMAP was never designed for high-volume moves or copy uploads. To do this, you will be best served (in my opinion), by creating manually-run filters to COPY (not move) messages, folder by folder, to the desired IMAP folder. When done, do some spot-checking to ensure messages are not corrupted (not likely, but possible, depending on network connection).

creator: @next

content: On your question: - set one folder to your preferences and highlight it - click the icon on right side of the menu bar of message list pane - click to apply current view to> and highlight 'folder and subfolders and PAUSE - a menu opens to left with account name. highlight that and PAUSE - another menu opens to its left with account name at top. CLICK THERE and a confirmation message will appear to confirm setting all folders in the account. - repeat the above for each account
creator: davidsk

content:
There might be a simpler way to do this, but in the meantime I found some css code that works. 

/* The To: email addresses */ #MsgHeadersToolbar .address-pill  {   background-color: #336699 !important;   color:            White   !important;   height:           40px    !important;   font-size: 18px !important; }  /* The To: address "input" box (ie with cursor) */ #MsgHeadersToolbar .recipients-container input {   border-radius:    3px     !important;   color:            white   !important;   background-color: #336699 !important;   padding-inline:   2px     !important;   font-size: 18px !important; }


https://www.elevenforum.com/t/thunderbird-115-css-customization.16320/post-342200

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the numbers and colours as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

See the attached pictures that show the effect with and without the css.
